instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air battery issue
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air battery issue, problem is laptop will power on from the keyboard when the mains is plugged in but not when its on battery only, i dont mean the laptop turns on when the mains is connected i mean it turns on via the keyboard when mains connected but not when just on battery , the laptop sees the battery , charges the battery and even runs from the battery if started from the mains supply, im a bit confused and any help would be thankfull

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air battery issue
threads.message: Inspect the trackpad and trackpad flex for corrosion. Have you tried a new trackpad/trackpad cable/keyboard?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air battery issue
threads.message: Hi , just tried the board in a known good housing and still the same, i cant see any signs of spillage anyway

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air battery issue
threads.message: Inspect for corrosion near or under the SMC

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air battery issue
threads.message:
Try battery alone disconnecting LIO flex.
Do you get 3V42 without charger connected?
<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> reacts when trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>?
First be sure <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> has 3V; all tests no charger...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air battery issue
threads.message: cant see any corrosion anywhere on this board but reflowed the smc just incase, tried without lio flex connected, i do get 3v42 without charger connected, get 3.3v at <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> does get a slight milliamp draw when i short <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>, could it be the smc is faulty somehow ???, would it be worth changing it or would it be a waste of time ???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> macbook air battery issue
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> should stay low all the time you press power button; or shorting <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads.
